TEXT.TITLE: GHANA COCOA PURCHASES FALL, CUMULATIVE STILL UP
TEXT.BODY: The Ghana Cocoa Board said it purchased 1,323 tonnes of cocoa in the 21st week, ended February 26, of the 1986/87 main crop season, compared with 1,961 tonnes the previous week and 1,344 tonnes in the 21st week ended March six of the 1985/86 season, the board said. Cumulative purchases so far this season stand at 216,095 tonnes, still up on the 201,966 tonnes purchased by the 21st week of last season, the Board said. Reuter
